title: Russia deploys hypersonic Oreshnik missiles in Belarus amid Europe tensions
description: Moscow has positioned nuclear-capable hypersonic missiles in Belarus as tensions rise in Europe.
content:
![Member of a crew stands next to a stationary missile during practice.](https://www.aljazeera.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/13347246-1758075123.jpg?resize=770%2C513&quality=80)

Iskander-M missile system crews practise delivering group strikes during the Zapad-2025 joint military drills of the Russian and Belarus armed forces, at an undisclosed location in Russia \[File: Russian Defence Ministry Press Service/EPA\]

[![](https://www.aljazeera.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/1747788086488-1748902760.jpg?resize=96%2C96&quality=80)](https://www.aljazeera.com/author/david-d-lee)

By [David D. Lee](https://www.aljazeera.com/author/david-d-lee) and Reuters

Published On 31 Dec 202531 Dec 2025

Russia has released footage showing the deployment of its [Oreshnik](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/11/22/what-do-we-know-about-russias-new-ballistic-missile-oreshnik) hypersonic missile system in Belarus, a move that could strengthen Moscow’s ability to target Europe in a potential future conflict.

The Russian state news agency TASS reported on Tuesday that this marks the first public display of the mobile Oreshnik systems. President Vladimir Putin has described the missiles as impossible to intercept, citing speeds that are more than 10 times the speed of sound.
